body.p: Complete this chart by matching each vessel type with its tunic characteristics.

feedback.p: Correct. Elastic arteries contain the elastic fibers that allow them to more easily absorb blood ejected from the heart and then direct it toward the tissues as they “recoil”.
Incorrect. Elastic arteries contain a greater amount of elastic fibers that allow them to more easily absorb blood ejected from the heart and then direct it toward the tissues as they “recoil”.
Incorrect. Elastic arteries accept the blood being ejected from the heart, they do not respond to nervous and hormonal signals to regulate flow into organs for tissues, as these vessels do.
Incorrect. Elastic arteries accept the blood being ejected from the heart, they do not control flow into individual capillaries, as these vessels do.
Incorrect. Elastic arteries have multiple thick layers that inhibit exchange, which is what these vessels specialize in.
Incorrect. Elastic arteries have much thicker walls than these vessels.
Incorrect. Although elastic arteries have large diameters, they do not return blood to the heart as these vessels do.
Incorrect. Muscular arteries are not as well adapted for absorbing the blood ejected from the heart because their tunica media is not as elastic.
Correct. Muscular arteries deliver blood under high pressure to the organs and tissues.
Incorrect. Muscular arteries deliver blood under high pressure to the organs and tissues, but do not have the same ability to control flow into tissues as the vessels as these vessels do.
Incorrect. Muscular arteries deliver blood under high pressure to the organs and tissues, but do not have the same ability to control flow into individual capillaries as these vessels do.
Incorrect. Muscular arteries have multiple thick layers that inhibit exchange, which is what these vessels specialize in.
Incorrect. Muscular arteries have much thicker walls than these vessels.
Incorrect. Muscular arteries have much thicker walls than these vessels.
Incorrect. Arterioles are much too small to accept the blood ejected from the heart, which is what these vessels do.

Incorrect. Arterioles are the vessels immediately distal to the ones we are looking for here. Arterioles are adapted to be better controlled by the autonomic nervous system than the vessels that carry flow to the organs.
Correct. Arterioles are adapted to respond to the sympathetic nervous system and other signaling molecules to control flow into organs and tissues.

Incorrect. Arterioles are adapted to respond to the sympathetic nervous system and other signaling molecules to control flow into organs and tissues, but they do not control flow into individual capillaries as these vessels do.
Incorrect. Arterioles have multiple thick layers that inhibit exchange, which is what these vessels specialize in.
Incorrect. Arterioles have much thicker walls than these vessels.
Incorrect. Arterioles have much thicker walls than these vessels.
Incorrect. Metarterioles are much too small to accept the blood ejected from the heart, which is what these vessels do.
Incorrect. Metarterioles do not have as well-developed of a tunica externa as the vessels we are looking for here.
Incorrect. Metarterioles do play an important role in regulation of flow, but they do so into individual capillaries and not into the tissue in general, like these vessels do.
Correct. Metarterioles contain precapillary sphincters that can regulate flow into individual capillaries, depending on the needs of local tissues.
Incorrect. Metarterioles have more than one layer in their vessels walls.
Incorrect. Metarterioles are proximal to capillaries: these vessels are distal to capillaries.
Incorrect. Metarterioles are proximal to capillaries and have precapillary sphincters; these vessels are distal to capillaries and have valves.
Incorrect. Capillaries are much too small and thin to accept the blood ejected from the heart, which is what these vessels do.
Incorrect. Capillaries are much too thin to contain blood that is under high pressure, which is what the vessels we are looking for here do.
Incorrect. Capillaries do not have a tunica media, therefore cannot be the best fit here.
Incorrect. Capillaries to not contain a tunica media, like these vessels
Correct. Capillaries contain only a tunica interna, which greatly decreases the distance over which substances must diffuse during exchange of nutrients and gasses.
Incorrect. Capillaries contain fewer layers in their walls than these vessels.
Incorrect. Capillaries contain fewer layers in their walls than these vessels.
Incorrect. Venules are not strong enough to accept the high pressure blood from the heart, which is what these vessels do.
Incorrect. Venules are not strong enough to carry blood under high pressure, which is what these vessels do.
Incorrect. Venules have a thinner tunica media than these vessels.
Incorrect. Venules are distal to capillaries; therefore they cannot regulate flow into them.
Incorrect. Although some venules do participate in exchange, they still contain more than one layer.
Correct. Venules generally contain all 3 layers in their walls, but they are thin and easily distended.
Incorrect. Although venules are adapted for returning blood to the heart, they are smaller than these vessels.
Incorrect. Veins are not strong enough to accept the high pressure blood from the heart, which is what these vessels do.
Incorrect. Veins are not strong enough to carry blood under high pressure, which is what these vessels do.
Incorrect. Veins are not well adapted to control blood flow due to their thin tunica media, which is much better developed in these vessels.
Incorrect. Veins are distal to capillaries; therefore they cannot regulate flow into them.
Incorrect. Veins have multiple layers that inhibit exchange, which is what these vessels specialize in.
Incorrect. Veins are similar to these vessels, but have larger diameters and a better developed tunica externa.
Correct. Veins are large vessels that are specialized in storing blood (easily distensible) and returning blood to the heart (contain valves).
